message: Oops - typo on the signup page. "I would an invite to the beta " S/B "I would LIKE an invite to the beta ". Yes?

we are going to be heading into a public beta soon and are looking to build up a base of people who would be interested in participating.  General concept and signup is at www.provord.com, interested in any initial feedback on the concept...
@kvan nothing bugs me more!
...pun intended
aha good spot
What's the problem you're trying to solve?
fixed, thanks
Quick turnaround! :-)
great question.

@timjoslyn Sounds interesting, Tim. Just signed up. I'm kind of a sucker these days for things related to collaborative consumption/ peer to peer economies. Not that Provord is *exactly* based on either of those things, but I see it complimentary. Rock on + good luck!

Many of us own objects that have a history associated with them, be it a service.maintenance history, a history of it's provenance etc.  Today that history usually consists of bits of paper and receipts kept in a folder somewhere that can get lost or damaged over time.  Provord allows you to virtualise that history preserving it.  Provord also allows you to add new media to that history such as videos, digital images etc making it richer.  Why shouldn't the history of a musical instrument include a video of it being played in concert for example, or all the digital photos taken of your car form a permanent part of its record.  Next you can then use the history to your advantage, for example when you look to sell your object, make it's history available to others to help you in that process. The driver for all of this this is the fact that history creates value.  If you go and look at 2 pieces of of antique furniture or 2 classic cars etc and one can demonstrate where it came from and what has been done to it and the other cannot.  In the majority of cases you will pay more for the item with a comprehensive history.
@thesethings thanks!
I could have used this 12 months ago before I lost the receipt for a Dell monitor that has since gone faulty :(
better late than never!
Interesting idea. A kind of carfax for everyday objects.
curious: whats the monetization strategry?

couple of aspects to monetization strategy, firstly is affiliate relationships with companies that can increase the value of your history e.g. certificate of build for a classic car from manufacturer or marque, valuation of antiques/jewellry etc.  Secondly we have an engine to allow targeted discreet in site advertising to users based on the profile of the objects they own e.g. I would like to target all piano owners globally/regionally/locally, I would like to target owners of x type of classic car etc etc

Great concept. I have been looking for something like this. Was going to use Delicious Library but it is more for media. I am sure you have already considered this, but keep in mind that this would be a great tool for people to keep inventory of their house for insurance purposes as well. Might be some monetization in that alone (premium accounts or even deals with insurance companies). Just thinking out loud.

@timjoslyn Please submit your startup to http://startupli.st and you'll be placed in front of a great community of early adopters and potential investors. Every startup is filtered into BetaCandy.com, where industry professionals review, rate, and give you valuable feedback to help improve your product and connect you with an investor.
